hints.content:
When **multiplying** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the **left**.

When **dividing** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the **right**.

Each digit of $25{,}400$ is one place to the left of the same digits in the number $2{,}540$.

Ten thousands | Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones
:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |:-:
 | $\swarrow\goldD2$ | $\swarrow\purpleD5$ | $\swarrow\blueD4$ | $\swarrow\greenD0$
$\goldD2$ | $\purpleD5$ | $\blueD4$ | $\greenD0$ | $0$

Moving each digit to the left means multiplying by $10$:  

$\goldD2{,}\purpleD5\blueD4\greenD0\times10 = \goldD2\purpleD5{,}\blueD4\greenD00$

question.content:
**Complete the equation with a $\times$ or $\div$ sign.**
